HAMP-1.Description of CMU Components:
Energy from waste facility located in Chineham Hampshire - Postcode RG24 8LL. It is a municipal waste incineration plant. It is based on one boiler supplying steam to one turbine-generator. Exhaust steam is condensed in a Air cooled condenser. The site normally operates at baseload . The auxiliary load is self supplied by the generator prior to export metering.  The power factor used is 0.85 for this CMU.


We found out that using the rules' method to calculate the capacity some of our plants would not be able to meet their obligation. For instance:Tyseley ERF would have to register for 28.74 MW (de-rated to 25.19 MW). And in the past two years during winter period the plant generated that capacity only 45 % of the time. This is due to the plant technology: it is an Energy from waste facility. Waste is a fuel whose characteristics (moisture content-calorific value...) can change during the year and therefore the output of the plants can change a lot. We can therefore have a few high generation periods in the year in the conditions are good and a lower generation the other times.
Therefore we decided to calculate ourselves a capacity we would be confident to register with. We would then compare it to the rules' method calculated value; If the new value is higher than the one calculated with the rules' method then we followed the rules' method. If our method would give a lower capacity; we selected the value calculated with our method.
The method used is: the de rated capacity we are pre-qualifying for to bid is calculated based on the two past years winter historical output (see documents).
The de-rated capacity is calculated as the capacity the plant was able to achieve 80% of the time in the previous two winters. Then the value was multiplied by the inverse of the de-rating factor to obtain the Connection capacity.

In the case of this site : The site would achieve more than 90% of the time the capacity calculated using on of the CM's rules so we followed the rules.

HEAT19.Description of CMU Components: The CMU at the Heathfield Landfill site in Devon will be made up of three reciprocating engines generating from natural gas. In their current state, these engines have been designed to generate from landfill gas, but will be converted to natural gas and then recommissioned, ahead of the delivery year. The three components of the CMU (referenced VIR074, VIR079 and VIR080) are Cummins QSV91 units, built in 2008 and rated at 1,750kW. Each engine generates at 415V, which is then stepped up to 11kV and then to 33kV for export.
HEAT19.Location and Post Code: Heathfield Landfill, John Acres Lane, Kingsteignton, Devon, TQ12 3GP
